description: Number patterns, sequences, symbol equations, simultaneous equations, and algebraic reasoning.

concepts.name: Symbol Equations
concepts.description: Solving equations where symbols represent unknown numbers
question_patterns: In the equations below, find the value of {symbol}.
example_stems: Square always represents the same number. If 9 x square = 108 and triangle + square = 36, what is triangle?
If star = 5 and star + moon = 12, what is moon?

concepts.name: Visual Simultaneous Equations
concepts.description: Solving systems where items (stars, hearts, boxes) have point values
common_misconceptions: Not setting up equations correctly from visuals
question_patterns: If {X} stars and {Y} hearts = {A} points, and {P} stars and {Q} hearts = {B} points, what is 1 star + 1 heart?
Three boxes weighed in pairs give {A}, {B}, {C}. What do all three weigh together?
example_stems: 3 stars and 5 hearts = 27 points. 5 stars and 7 hearts = 41 points. What is 1 star + 1 heart?
Boxes weighed in pairs: 28kg, 32kg, 38kg. Combined weight of all three?

concepts.name: Number Patterns and Sequences
concepts.description: Finding rules, extending sequences, finding missing terms
common_misconceptions: Not checking pattern works for all given terms
Errors with patterns involving multiple operations
question_patterns: In pattern: {sequence}, what is the {nth} term?
Each term is sum of previous {n} terms. Find missing value.
What is the rule for this sequence?
example_stems: Pattern: 2, X, 0, Y, 6, Z. Each number is sum of previous three. What is Z?

concepts.name: Algebraic Expressions
concepts.description: Translating word problems into expressions, evaluating expressions
question_patterns: Tom is {X} years older than Sam. If Sam is {Y}, how old is Tom?
example_stems: A rectangle's length is 3 more than twice its width. If width is w, what is perimeter?
There are n boys and twice as many girls. Total students?

concepts.name: Perimeter with Unknown Dimensions
concepts.description: Finding dimensions when perimeter changes by adding shapes
common_misconceptions: Not accounting for hidden edges when shapes join
question_patterns: Shape X has perimeter {P1}. Adding a rectangle makes shape Y with perimeter {P2}. What is the rectangle's width?
Two identical rectangles joined side-by-side. New perimeter is {P}. Find width.
example_stems: Shape X has perimeter 64cm. Adding a card makes shape Y with perimeter 82cm. Find width of cards.
Two squares joined: perimeter 24cm. What is side length of each square?
